result.execSummary:
The defendant Oliver J Vazquez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Notice of right to seek postconviction relief

3:01 PM ADA Carl Jacob Lazarus in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Oliver J Vazquez in court with Attorney Mark A Leonard. Attorney A. Bogost appeared via telephone for the victim.

Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to counts 1 and 2.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

Victim Rights Compliance

Statement by victim, AGC. Statement by ADA Lazarus. Statement by Attorney Leonard. Statement by Defendant.

COUNTS #1 and 2   
Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 2 years, each count cc 

CONDITIONS:
-Maintain full-time employment/education or a combination of both or be seeking same and treatment for 40 hours a week. Any week not reaching 40 hours must complete 20 hours community service
-No contact, direct or indirect with: AGC 
-DOC DV treatment
-Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals 
-Provide DNA sample
-Court finds DE eligible for expunction under 973.015 
-Any other conditions DOC may impose

COURT COSTS:
Ct #1 and 2
- All CC waived. DNA surcharge and V/W surcharge payment due on probation

-Days credit for time already served: zero credit 
-Days credit if revoked: zero credit

DE advised of post-conviction rights

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with AGC or any immediate family member of AGC.
- Defendant shall attend high school only at the times required for him to attend his classes. 
- Defendant shall not be in the 1100 block of Morraine View Dr. 
Trial Judge - Br 2 

Defendant has acknowledged and agreed to terms and conditions of bond. Defendant must return signed bond form within 10 days of today. Any bail money previously posted will not be returned until a signed bond form is on file with the Clerk of Courts.

10:55 AM Defendant appeared.  Benjamin Wagner appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Amy Riva Blumenfeld Bogost appeared on behalf of the victim. All parties by Zoom. The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts. Statement by Amy Riva Blumenfeld Bogost.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
